Context:
Program Name: Game – Art
Code: G129
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $8,972.00 *
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Design
Location: Online
Specializations: Game modelling or game animation
Semester Availability:
- Fall 2024: Open for domestic students
- Winter 2025: Open for domestic students
Program Description: A rigorous program of study focused on video game art creation to break into the industry. Students will develop commercial quality games and create a portfolio/demo showcasing their skills in game development and chosen area of specialization.
* Domestic Tuition is subject to change and may not include additional fees or other expenses.

Context:
Extracted Information:

Program Specializations:
- Game Modelling

Field Education Options:
- Eligible for non-mandatory external field placements in semester 5 and/or semester 6.

Career & Postgraduate Study Opportunities:
- Careers in various game and digital media studios, including: character art, 2D environment art, 3D environment art, 3D modelling, 3D animation, character modelling, level design, cinematic animation, special effects, texture design, user interface design, quality assurance.
- Educational pathways available after graduation.

Required Courses:
Year 1:
Semester 1:
- DESN1037: Drawing I
- DESN1084: 2D Digital Art I
- DESN1118: Introduction to Modelling
- DESN1130: Interactive Prototyping I
- DESN1083: Studio Lab 1
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts

Semester 2:
- DESN1038: Drawing II
- DESN2015: 2D Digital Art II
- DESN1119: Introduction to Animation
- DESN1131: Interactive Prototyping II
- DESN1086: Studio Lab 2
- DESN1189: Ludology and Game History

Game Modelling Specialization (Year 2):
Semester 3:
- DESN2012: Environment Modelling I
- DESN1132: Game Art and Architecture I
- DESN2014: Level Design I
- DESN2010: Texturing and Shading I
- DESN2013: Studio Lab 3

Semester 4:
- DESN2018: Environment Modelling II
- DESN1133: Game Art and Architecture II
- DESN2016: Level Design II
- DESN2011: Texturing and Shading II
- DESN2017: Studio Lab 4

Year 3:
Semester 5:
- DESN3014: 3D Sculpting I
- DESN3016: Organic Modelling I
- DESN3018: Technical Art for Game Engines 1
- DESN3020: Cinematics I
- DESN3010: Studio Lab 5.

The program focuses on developing skills in areas such as game development, programming, design, and art. The graduate is expected to analyze differences in game genres, understand the history of video games, contribute to game projects as an individual and a team member, and continuously develop professionally.

Context:
Program Information:
- The text relates to a program offered at George Brown College in the games industry.
- Students will develop strategies for personal and professional growth in the games industry.
- Compliance with relevant laws, regulations, standards, and ethics codes is required.
- Students will create pre-production art using design tools and drawing techniques.
- Original game assets will be created to meet requirements outlined in game design documents or creative briefs.
- Students will engage in world building and level design within various game engines.
- User interface design will be generated to optimize both aesthetics and function of gameplay.

Financial Information:
- Tuition for the first two semesters is estimated at $8,972.
- Additional costs include materials, student services, ancillary fees, Adobe Creative Cloud subscription, Wacom Intuos Pro Medium Tablet, Digital Tutors subscription, and International Game Developers Association (IGDA) membership.
- The program is approved for OSAP funding.

Admission Information:
- Applicants must have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent.
- A Grade 12 English credit (C or U) is required.
- An application questionnaire and portfolio are required from qualified applicants.
- Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English or upgrade their English credits.

*Note: The information contained in this text is subject to change without notice.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Game – Art Program G129 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program Information:
- The text mentions a program in the School of Design at George Brown College.
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
- Contact information for the School of Design: Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 3129, Email: game@georgebrown.ca.
- The program is located at George Brown College's Waterfront Campus, 3 Lower Jarvis St., Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
- Course exemptions may apply based on college or university credits, more information can be found in the Transfer Guide.

Campus Information:
- The School of Design resides in a new 103,000-square-foot facility with features such as virtual and augmented reality lab, usability and testing lab, Future Ways of Living lab, peer tutor lab, digital sandbox, incubators, prototyping and workshop spaces, design and innovation showcase spaces.
- Information sessions and campus tours are available to answer questions, learn about program content and career options, meet professors and staff, and experience the classroom environment.

Application Information:
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
- Applicants may need to have grades higher than the minimum requirements stated for admission.

Contact Information:
- General inquiries can be made to the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
- Virtual tour and campus booking can be done on the George Brown College website.
